title: Web-based visualization for 3D data in archaeology: The ADS 3D viewer
abstract: This paper presents the ADS 3D Viewer, a web-based visualization system for the preservation and analysis of archaeological stratigraphy integrated within a trusted digital repository. The project investigated how browser-based 3D graphics using WebGL could create an open-access infrastructure for archaeological data.
authors: F. Galeazzi, M. Callieri, M. Dellepiane, M. Charno, J. Richards, R. Scopigno
keywords: 3D visualization, WebGL, archaeological stratigraphy, digital preservation, open access

title: Template Based Semantic Integration: From Legacy Archaeological Datasets to Linked Data
abstract: This work examines methods for transforming legacy archaeological datasets into linked open data using template-based semantic integration approaches. The paper demonstrates practical applications within the Archaeology Data Service infrastructure.
authors: C. Binding, M. Charno, S. Jeffrey, K. May, D. Tudhope
journal: International Journal on Semantic Web and Information Systems
keywords: linked data, semantic web, CIDOC CRM, archaeological data, data integration

title: From the Slope of Enlightenment to the Plateau of Productivity: Developing Linked Data at the ADS
abstract: This paper discusses the development and implementation of linked open data infrastructure at the Archaeology Data Service, focusing on ingesting excavation data into triple stores and exposing it as linked data following FAIR principles.
authors: S. Jeffrey, C. Binding, D. Tudhope, K. May, M. Charno
journal: Archaeology in the Digital Era: Papers from the 40th Annual Conference of Computer Applications and Quantitative Methods in Archaeology
keywords: linked open data, triple store, RDF, SPARQL, digital archaeology

title: Pattern based mapping and extraction via CIDOC CRM
abstract: This work explores pattern-based approaches for mapping archaeological data to the CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model, enabling semantic interoperability across heritage information systems.
authors: D. Tudhope, C. Binding, K. May, M. Charno
keywords: CIDOC CRM, semantic mapping, cultural heritage, data extraction

title: An Interactive Image Using SVG and Ajax in Archaeology
abstract: This work examines the application of Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) and Ajax technologies within an archaeological context. An interactive web-based map tool was developed for the Sikyon Survey Project, incorporating principles from Virtual Research Environments to facilitate off-site project collaboration.
keywords: mapping, web development, SVG, Ajax, survey, Sikyon, Peloponnese
